page.title: 03St Mary's Primary School
page.content: St Mary's School was built in 1896. It is on Barkers Lane Sale. The school has had 10 headteachers including the one we have now. At the moment there are 237 children, 40% boys and 60% girls. There are two playgrounds and 1 field. We have planted bulbs and plants in a corner of it. There are 52 in the Choir. During the day and night 22 adults look after the this school. We have got 1 caretaker and he has an assistant with him. The girls' Winter uniform is a grey skirt, blue and white tie, a white blouse and a grey cardigan. The boys' Winter uniform is grey shorts (trousers for the top class boys. The Summer uniform is a blue checked dress with a grey cardigan. The boys wear grey shorts, white or grey shirts, the same tie and a grey jumper.
